did.abstract: Papers include a land bounty certificate; a copy of the will of Mary (Osborne) Hall; a warrant, 1784, relating to damages owed to Lyman Hall from James Martin and Thomas Garrett; and an extract from a speech given by Lyman Hall in the Georgia House of Assembly, 1783, about a controversy over the Georgia chief justice and grand jury. The copy of Mary Hall's will includes provisions for the purchase of mourning rings, the manumission of two enslaved people, and for the housing and furnishing of her old and infirm enslaved people.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Lyman Hall was a physician, clergman, and statesman from Savannah, Georgia. He signed the Declaration of Independence as a representative of Georgia.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Papers include a land bounty certificate; a copy of the will of Mary (Osborne) Hall; a warrant, 1784, relating to damages owed to Lyman Hall from James Martin and Thomas Garrett; and an extract from a speech given by Lyman Hall in the Georgia House of Assembly, 1783, about a controversy over the Georgia chief justice and grand jury. The copy of Mary Hall's will includes provisions for the purchase of mourning rings, the manumission of two enslaved people, and for the housing and furnishing of her old and infirm enslaved people.
